DataElement.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary esophageal and esophagogastric junction squamous cell carcinoma based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma Clinical T Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A squamous cell carcinoma arising from the esophagus.  It is associated with a long history of tobacco and alcohol abuse and is exceedingly rare before the age of 30.  The median age is around 65 in both males and females.  It is located mostly in the middle and lower third of the esophagus.  Grossly, polypoid, ulcerated, plaque-like and occult lesions have been described.  The microscopic features are the same as in other squamous cell carcinomas.  Any degree of differentiation may occur, and variation within a single tumor is common.  The prognosis is poor._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A squamous cell carcinoma arising from the esophagus.  It is associated with a long history of tobacco and alcohol abuse and is exceedingly rare before the age of 30.  The median age is around 65 in both males and females.  It is located mostly in the middle and lower third of the esophagus.  Grossly, polypoid, ulcerated, plaque-like and occult lesions have been described.  The microscopic features are the same as in other squamous cell carcinomas.  Any degree of differentiation may occur, and variation within a single tumor is common.  The prognosis is poor.

Concepts.definition: A squamous cell carcinoma arising from the esophagus.  It is associated with a long history of tobacco and alcohol abuse and is exceedingly rare before the age of 30.  The median age is around 65 in both males and females.  It is located mostly in the middle and lower third of the esophagus.  Grossly, polypoid, ulcerated, plaque-like and occult lesions have been described.  The microscopic features are the same as in other squamous cell carcinomas.  Any degree of differentiation may occur, and variation within a single tumor is common.  The prognosis is poor.

One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10-4-18 Changed from Draft New to Released/tmt.  9-24-18 tt created for standardization.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to carcinomas including squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, adenosquamous carcinoma, undifferentiated carcinoma, neuroendocrine cancers, and adenocarcinoma with neuroendocrine features. Sarcomas, nonepithelial cancers, and gastrointestinal stromal tumors are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pT4b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pT4b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with tumor invading other adjacent structures, such as the aorta, vertebral body, or airway. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pT4b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with tumor invading other adjacent structures, such as the aorta, vertebral body, or airway. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pT4a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pT4a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with tumor invading the pleura, pericardium, azygos vein, diaphragm, or peritoneum. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pT4a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with tumor invading the pleura, pericardium, azygos vein, diaphragm, or peritoneum. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with tumor invading adjacent structures. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with tumor invading adjacent structures. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with tumor invading adventitia. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with tumor invading adventitia. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with tumor invading the muscularis propria. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with tumor invading the submucosa. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with tumor invading the submucosa. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with tumor invading the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with tumor invading the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with a finding of high-grade dysplasia, defined as malignant cells confined to the epithelium by the basement membrane. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with a finding of high-grade dysplasia, defined as malignant cells confined to the epithelium by the basement membrane. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with tumor invading the lamina propria or muscularis mucosae. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
